explainability.findings: Marriott uses Explainable AI (XAI) techniques, specifically LIME and SHAP, to understand guest review sentiments and identify areas for improvement. Sources also reference recommendations for explainability mechanisms to prevent algorithmic discrimination.
explainability.path_to_improvement: Publish user-facing explanation interfaces or documented appeal workflows.

relevant_sources.summary: This technical paper on "Leveraging Explainable AI to Enhance Consumer Insight" provides evidence for **explainability** and **transparency** by detailing Marriott International's use of XAI techniques like LIME and SHAP to understand guest review sentiments and identify areas for improvement. The paper also supports **fairness** by highlighting XAI's role in mitigating algorithmic bias, and **governance** and **oversight** through discussions on the necessity of strategic oversight and training for XAI outputs. Furthermore, it touches upon **privacy** by outlining requirements for data privacy and consent in AI integration, and **external accountability** by positioning XAI adoption as a proactive compliance measure for evolving AI regulations.
relevant_sources.title: Leveraging Explainable AI to Enhance Consumer Insight - IJERET

relevant_sources.summary: This technical paper, "AI Governance in the Hospitality Industry - AIGN," provides evidence for explainability, external_accountability, fairness, governance, oversight, privacy, and transparency. The paper supports these pillars by discussing Marriott International's implementation of AI for building maintenance and algorithmic pricing, recommending fairness audits for pricing algorithms, transparency disclosures, and explainability mechanisms to prevent algorithmic discrimination. It also highlights the integration of ethical principles, data control, security audits, AI societal impact assessments, and adaptive governance frameworks.
relevant_sources.title: AI Governance in the Hospitality Industry - AIGN

external_accountability.findings: A report mentions AI risks, liabilities, and regulatory scrutiny, indicating the importance of external accountability policies. Sources describe XAI adoption as a proactive compliance measure for evolving AI regulations. Additionally, sources reference AI societal impact assessments.
external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Publish third-party audit results, certifications, or regulatory compliance documentation.

relevant_sources.summary: The Marriott International 2024 Form 10-K Annual Report provides evidence for **governance**, **fairness**, and **external accountability**. The report discusses the integration of AI technologies and the associated risks, highlighting the need for governance to manage these evolving threats and security risks. It also acknowledges potential AI impacts such as bias and inaccuracies, implying a need for fairness controls, and mentions AI risks, liabilities, and regulatory scrutiny, indicating the importance of external accountability policies.
relevant_sources.title: Marriott International 2024 Form 10-K Annual Report

fairness.findings: Marriott acknowledges potential AI impacts like bias and inaccuracies, implying a need for fairness controls. Sources reference the role of Explainable AI (XAI) in mitigating algorithmic bias. Recommendations for fairness audits for pricing algorithms and explainability mechanisms are referenced to prevent algorithmic discrimination.
fairness.path_to_improvement: Publish bias testing results, outcome monitoring, or vendor fairness certifications.

governance.findings: Marriott details its AI principles and governance policies, including a four-part AI governance framework and an AI playbook with policies for safe and reliable AI use cases. The company details a "Governance first" framework, emphasizing responsible adoption to guide AI pilots. Marriott's approach to trustworthy AI governance describes semantic layers and explainability, with an emphasis on embedded governance from the design phase and federated governance at scale. Sources also reference the integration of ethical principles, data control, security audits, AI societal impact assessments, and adaptive governance frameworks.
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This blog post from CIO Dive provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. It details Marriott's establishment of AI principles and governance policies, a four-part AI governance framework, and an AI playbook, all of which demonstrate a commitment to structured oversight and responsible AI deployment. The mention of scaling AI use cases and building AI architecture further supports the transparency pillar by indicating efforts to make AI capabilities understandable and manageable.
relevant_sources.title: Marriott checks out AI agents amid technology transformation - CIO Dive

relevant_sources.summary: This blog post from Cybersecurity Dive provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. The article details Marriott's AI governance framework, including their AI playbook and policies for ensuring safe and reliable AI use cases, demonstrating a commitment to responsible AI deployment. Furthermore, it highlights Marriott's exploration of AI capabilities and their monitoring of AI-powered tools, indicating transparency in their AI development and implementation efforts.
relevant_sources.title: Marriott checks out AI agents amid technology transformation - Cybersecurity Dive

relevant_sources.summary: This blog post provides evidence for the **governance**, **privacy**, and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. It supports governance by detailing Marriott's "Governance first" framework and their emphasis on responsible adoption guiding AI pilots. Evidence for privacy is found in the description of AI as a defense strategy that tightens data privacy and compliance protocols. Finally, the source supports transparency by describing specific AI use cases being piloted and monitored, indicating operational deployment.
relevant_sources.title: Marriott bets big on AI and cloud transformation - Hospitality.today

relevant_sources.summary: This Alation blog post, featuring Marriott's Director of Data Science & GenAI, provides evidence for **governance**, **oversight**, and **transparency**. The case study highlights Marriott's approach to trustworthy AI governance through semantic layers and explainability, emphasizing embedded governance from the design phase and federated governance at scale. Specific practices mentioned include logging agent actions, implementing "guardrails," and establishing metrics for agent evaluation (trust, accuracy) with source citation, all of which support the identified pillars.
relevant_sources.title: Data Products for Agentic AI: KeyBank and Marriott's Playbook - Alation

relevant_sources.summary: The "2025 Serve 360 Report: Around the World Highlights" provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. This company-owned report describes the use and purpose of AI systems in supporting sustainability goals, which supports transparency by outlining AI use cases. However, the report lacks explicit operational execution or policy commitments, indicating a need for further detail to fully support governance.
relevant_sources.title: 2025 Serve 360 Report: Around the World Highlights

transparency.findings: Marriott's approach to transparency includes exploring and monitoring AI capabilities and tools, with specific AI use cases being piloted and monitored. Sources describe Marriott's efforts to scale AI use cases and build AI architecture to make AI capabilities understandable and manageable, incorporating semantic layers and explainability in its governance. Practices such as logging agent actions, implementing "guardrails," and establishing evaluation metrics for AI agents are specified, alongside the use of XAI techniques to understand guest review sentiments.
transparency.path_to_improvement: Publish detailed documentation (model cards, system specs) for AI systems deployed.

summary.overall_findings: Based on 10 publicly available sources, Marriott International's published materials address all 7 evaluated pillars, with documented public evidence for each. For instance, explainability disclosures detail the use of XAI techniques like LIME and SHAP to understand guest review sentiments. Oversight practices include logging agent actions and establishing metrics for agent evaluation, while governance materials outline a four-part AI governance framework. Additionally, transparency efforts focus on scaling AI use cases and building architecture to make AI capabilities understandable, and privacy materials describe AI as a defense strategy that tightens data privacy protocols.
